header.div: Complete the plan on the right by choosing a suitable counter-argument at the top. There are more counter-arguments than arguments, so you will not use them all.

section.span: Greater profits for the agriculture industry.
Tampering with nature is nothing new in agriculture.
GM crops could be grown in difficult environments such as semi-desert.
GM crops last longer in storage.
Farmers of GM crops are less dependent on environmentally harmful insecticides.
improved nutritional value of GM food
improved flavour and appearance of GM foods

div.p:
Argument 1 + Counter-argument
GM crops interfere with nature.
Counter-Argument

Argument 2 + Counter-argument
GM foods may be bad for our health.
Counter-Argument

Argument 3 + Counter-argument
GM crops may cause ecological damage (e.g. kill harmless insects).
Counter-Argument

section.p: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.

p.b: Present a written argument or case to an educated reader with no specialist knowledge of the following topic.

Biotechnology companies all over the world are developing different types of genetically modified (GM) crops. However, not enough is known about the effects of these crops on our health and on the environment. Interfering with nature in this way should be prohibited.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?

section.p: You should write at least 250 words.
You should use your own ideas, knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence.

In Set 6 we saw how a balanced 'for and against' composition can be written by matching arguments and counter-arguments to form paragraphs. A similar outline can be used for a 'one-sided' composition. In this case, however, linking phrases are used to 'refute' each argument with a counter-argument.
